def.dt: :information in the form of a table, diagram, etc. a chart showing the number of cars sold each month see also bar chart flow chart pie chart
:a record of information about a medical patient The doctor consulted the patient's chart. see picture at hospital
:a map of an area (such as the sky or ocean) used by pilots, sailors, etc.

:a list that shows which music recordings have sold the most during a recent period of time a chart-topper [=a recording that is bought more than any other recording during a particular time] usually plural usually used with the The record went to the top of the charts. the country music charts
:to make a chart of (an area) They charted the bay.
:to mark (something) on a chart They charted the course of the ship.
:to make a plan for (something) She wanted to chart her own career path. He will try to chart a new course for the company.
:to note the changes, progress, etc., in (something) a book that charts [=chronicles] the rise and fall of the Roman Empire analysts charting trends in the stock market
:a chart that has numbers and letters of different sizes and that is used for testing someone's vision
:a chart that consists of a series of large pieces of paper which are attached at the top and which are used to present information to an audience by turning over one piece of paper at a time
:a chart that shows each step of a process using special symbols that are connected by lines
:a chart consisting of a circle that is divided into parts to show the size of the different amounts that are a part of a whole amount
